intro: Antirrhinum flavum, commonly known as the yellow snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, tubular, two-lipped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant produces showy, bilaterally symmetrical blooms that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often growing in rocky or gravelly habitats. Antirrhinum flavum is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 60 centimeters, with linear, grass-like leaves along its stem.
